title: Unreal Engine Developer
description:
**Unreal Engine Developer**  

**Freelance / Contract**  

**Remote**  

**6 month contract**

  

Are you an experienced Unreal Engine developer with a passion for bringing real-time data to life? We are seeking a skilled Unreal Engine Consultant to enhance our state-of-the-art body tracking solutions. In this role, you’ll be responsible for integrating and optimizing skeleton-tracking data to create precise, real-time 3D visualizations.

**Key responsibilities**

* Integrate skeleton tracking and motion capture data into Unreal Engine.
* Develop and optimize animations of body movements for real-time visualization.
* Collaborate with data engineers and visualization specialists to ensure high-fidelity, smooth, and accurate representations.
* Troubleshoot, refine, and innovate visual effects and tracking systems in Unreal Engine to enhance viewer experience.

**Key experience and qualifications required**

  

You must have all of the following experience and competencies, which must be evidenced in your CV:

* Strong experience with Unreal Engine, especially in animation and, ideally, real-time visualization.
* Proficiency in skeleton tracking and motion capture workflows.

title: Motion Production Developer - IKEA Marketing & Communications AB
description:
**Job ID:** R0009650


**Date posted:** 10/11/2024


Hej!


Want to be a part of making everyday life better?


The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people – and we’re always searching for new and better ways to do it. We gather insights about life at home, learning about the needs and dreams of people all over the world. And we use our home furnishing knowledge to create products and solutions that will enable more people to live the life they want.


Through creativity, IKEA marketing & Communication AB connects the heart of IKEA to the hearts and minds of the many people. We plan and produce marketing and communication that enables our retail markets to grow and to position IKEA as a purpose-led business and an expert in the life at home. We are 400 co-workers located in Älmhult – the heart of IKEA. Our strength is our 400+ talented co-workers: strategists, channel experts, developers, photographers, motion media producers, 3D artists, graphic designers, copywriters, interior designers, and many more competences. We are proud of our craftsmanship and ability to unleash creativity at scale.  

  

At IKEA, collaborating on AI and 3D is an innovative fusion of creativity and technology that bridges virtual production, motion artistry, and advanced GenAI research. From streamlining workflows to automating processes, our goal is to scale production while keeping it future-proof and market-relevant. We push the boundaries of what’s possible, leading the industry in setting standards that ensure quality and longevity—whether in digital media or physical products. Our continuous partnerships with industry leaders and innovators fuel this journey, and we’re searching for motion and film production professionals who are also passionate or curious about GenAI, 3D, and automation to co-create with us in revolutionizing the future of production.

**Job Description**


As a Production Developer, you will lead the integration of AI, 3D and automation to smoother and more creative and efficient motion production to streamline workflows and develop new capabilities within the studio. Your focus will be on creating scalable, efficient production processes and ensuring industry-leading quality in both physical and digital media.


You will:

* Lead collaborations on virtual production, motion artistry, and AI to explore, develop, and establish new production capabilities.
* Drive the development of lean processes and automation solutions across the studio, optimizing workflows, reducing costs, and ensuring high quality for customer-facing solutions.
* Support the integration of new production workflows, tools, and standards.
* Act as a bridge between project teams and production to gather insights and improve capabilities.
* Stay up-to-date with trends in the media landscape, including GenAI, 3D, and motion production, and explore new innovations to enhance customer communication and production processes.

**Qualifications**  

We’re looking for an AI & 3D Production Developer who can consolidate and enhance AI and 3D production capability within content production development.


Qualifications:

* Extensive experience in motion production, including not limiting virtual production and animation.
* Up to date technologies in both media landscape and GenAI.
* Knowledge and experience in project leading, production leading, agile scrum and OKR WoW.
* Understanding and good to have experience with DCCs, i.e., 3D studio Max, Maya, Blender, Cinema 4D, Solid Works, and Realtime engines as well as production management tools such as ShotGrid etc.
* Understanding & basic knowledge in programming and scripting languages and tools, such as Python, Java, Jira etc.
* Experience working in a high-volume production environment with tight deadlines.
* Experience working in a multicultural, creative, and inclusive work environment.
* Fluent in English (spoken & written)


If you have the ability for strategic and abstract thinking, are hungry for challenges in the unknown and would like to grow into a more creative leadership you should apply for this role.

**Additional information**  

Älmhult is an inspirational working environment, based on creativity and innovation, which gives you the opportunity to work and interact with people from all around the world. This is a place where you can focus on doing what you love. There are no dress codes or offices closed. No day is ever the same. All ideas are welcome. Everyone tries to pitch in when needed, and failures are seen as a way of learning. When you enter our workplace, we want you to feel that you can inspire billions of people all over the world.


Want to make the world a little better with us? Then we want to hear from you!  

We look forward to receiving your application, your CV and a motivational letter in English no later than November 17. Note that we interview on a continuously basis and might close the opportunity to apply earlier.


If you have any questions regarding the role please contact Tao Ma, Production Development Manager at tao.ma3@inter.ikea.com. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Recruiter Jonas Levin at Jonas.levin@inter.ikea.com
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Backendutvecklare - .NET
description:
- Vill du vara en del av ett företag där din tekniska expertis gör en verklig skillnad? Som .NET-utvecklare får du möjlighet att vara med i utvecklingen av robusta och skalbara system som driver affärskritiska applikationer. Du kommer att arbeta med C# /.NET, molnlösningar (AWS, GCP, Azure) och API-design. Du kommer även få möjlighet att arbeta med microservices och containerbaserade arkitekturer (Docker, Kubernetes).


**Vad förväntar vi oss av dig?**


	* **Teknisk expertis:** Ungefär 3 års erfarenhet av backendutveckling och har jobbat en del i molnbaserade system.
	* **Problemlösare:** Du har en analytisk förmåga och kan tänka strategiskt för att hitta de bästa lösningarna.
	* **Driven och nyfiken:** Du har ett stort intresse för Java och backendutveckling och är ivrig att lära dig mer.
	* **Teamspelare:** Du trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team och är bra på att kommunicera.
	* **Språk:** Du är flytande i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. Viktigt för denna roll och potentiell kund är att du har svenskt medborgarskap.**Arbetsplats**  

Arbetsplatsen för den här rollen är Malmö med omnejd.


**Om Devoteam**  

Hos oss värderar vi medarbetarnas trivsel och utveckling högt. Vi har byggt en arbetskultur där människor känner sig inspirerade, utmanade och trygga. Vi tror att när du trivs och växer, så gör även våra lösningar det.


Vi är ett ledande IT-konsultföretag med en stark förankring i Malmös tech-community, både som Devoteam och f.d .Jayway. Vi är engagerade i att skapa långsiktiga relationer med både kunder och medarbetare. Vi drivs av en passion för teknik och innovation, och erbjuder skräddarsydda lösningar för företag inom en rad olika branscher. Bland våra initiativ kan nämnas Øredev, en av Skandinaviens största utvecklarkonferenser, som vi var med och grundade.


**Förmåner och praktisk information:**


	* Kontinuerligt lärande: Vi stöder kontinuerligt lärande med kompetensgrupper varannan vecka, deltagande på Øredev och löpande kompetensdagar för din professionella utveckling. Du har möjlighet att ta certifikat med någon av våra partners (AWS, Azure, GCP).
	* Ledighet och pension: Vi erbjuder 30 dagars semester, kompletterande föräldraledighetsersättning och tjänstepension enligt ITP1.
	* Hälsa och välbefinnande: Självklara förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tillgång till företagshälsovård, hälsokontroller och lunchyoga på kontoret.
	* Verktyg och utrustning: Du väljer själv de verktyg du behöver för att leverera och trivas i din arbetsmiljö.**Ansökan**  

För att ansöka, vänligen skicka din ansökan via länken nedan. Vi uppmuntrar tidiga ansökningar eftersom vi granskar dem löpande.

title: Developer
description:
**Om oss** 




 Mitt Skolval är marknadsledande inom skolplacering i Sverige. Vår SaaS-plattform effektiviserar och kvalitetssäkrar antagningsprocessen för grundskolan genom smarta matchningsalgoritmer och en användarvänlig e-tjänst för föräldrar. Idag hanterar vi närmare 40% av alla grundskoleplaceringar i landet.
 



 Med stark tillväxt och pågående expansion, både nationellt och snart internationellt, bygger vi nu upp ett internt utvecklingsteam. Vi är idag nio personer och söker engagerade utvecklare som vill vara med på vår spännande tillväxtresa.
 



  





**Om jobbet** 




 Hos oss blir du en del av ett tight team om 5 utvecklare där du får stort eget ansvar och kreativ frihet. Att dela med sig av sin kunskap och ständigt bidra till att förbättra vår plattform är en självklar utgångspunkt för hela teamet. Samarbetet mellan utvecklare och produktägare är nära och beslutsvägarna korta vilket innebär att tempot delvis är högt, men vi prioriterar teamkänsla och arbetsglädje.
 



  





**Vem letar vi efter?** 




 Vi söker dig som är en driven och självgående utvecklare med hög känsla för kvalitet och detaljer. Du är social, samarbetsvillig och bra på att förklara lösningar. Det är viktigt att du har förmåga att både ge och ta emot konstruktiv feedback. Du har en god problemlösningsförmåga kombinerat med säkerhetstänk. Vi tror också att din nyfikenhet och passion för att hitta nya lösningar kommer vara en stor tillgång för teamet.
 



  





 Då vi kommer att tillsätta flera tjänster letar vi därför efter olika profiler. Dina kvalifikationer beror på om du söker en tjänst inriktad på frontend eller backend. Saknar du någon kompetens men känner att detta är rätt för dig? Sök ändå - vi värderar rätt person och mindset högt!
 



  





**Backend** 




 Krav på erfarenhet och kompetenser:
 


* Mycket goda erfarenheter av Typescript och Node/Express i backend
* Erfarenhet av Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD och automation
* God förståelse för SQL (specifikt Mysql)
* Stark erfarenhet av att skriva modulär kod som är tydlig, testbar och underhållbar
* Erfarenhet av asynkrona system med tex meddelandehantering i Kafka
* Erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling
* Kandidatexamen inom system/mjukvaruutveckling eller motsvarande erfarenhet



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Helm, Redis, TRPC, AWS



  
 



**Frontend** 




 Krav på erfarenhet och kompetenser:
 


* Mycket goda erfarenheter av Typescript och React i frontend
* Stark erfarenhet av att skriva modulär kod som är tydlig, testbar och underhållbar
* Kandidatexamen inom system/mjukvaruutveckling eller motsvarande erfarenhet



  





 Meriterande:
 


* TRPC, Tailwind, UX/UI-design, OpenAPI



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Mitt Skolvals kontor är beläget i centrala Stockholm och det är möjligt att jobba delvis på distans. Vi erbjuder en konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner och tjänsten är på heltid med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Du ansöker genom att skicka ditt CV och personliga brev via mejl till jobb@mittskolval.se. Om du har frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Elisabet Olme på elisabet@mittskolval.se eller 0735442220.
 



  






 Vi kommer att tillsätta tjänster löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!

title: Power BI Developer
description:
* Job Title: Power BI Developer
* Company: BluEdge
* Max Price Rate: Open bid
* Location: Stockholm (SE), Remote (0%)
* Start Date: 01 Dec 2024
* End Date (renewable): 15 Dec 2025


 We are in need of a Senior BI Developer. The ideal candidate should be passionate about creating insightful reports and visualizations using Power BI. They should possess deep expertise and experience in working with Power BI and specifying report requirements. The candidate should have a strong drive for data analysis and visualization, and be able to develop and make available new reports and dashboards in Power BI based on specific needs from the business. Additionally, the candidate will work closely with the business to ensure that the reports being built meet their needs.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, the candidate needs to be service-oriented, responsive, and flexible. Strong collaboration and communication skills are essential, as well as the ability to work independently, be structured, and results-oriented. The role also involves acting as a mentor to internal staff to build internal expertise, both in IT and SFV's other operations.
   

  

**Requirements**
 Mandatory Requirements
   

  

* Minimum of four years of experience in developing Power BI solutions and reports.
* Experience in acting as a mentor for Power BI.
* Experience in designing and setting up a new environment for Power BI from scratch.
* Strong understanding of design principles and user-centered visualization.
* Experience in transforming complex datasets into easily understandable visualizations.
* Competence in SQL and data extraction from various data sources.
* Knowledge and experience of data and database models, preferably SQL.
* Competence in classifying and handling information security issues.


 Preferred Qualifications
   

  

* Certified in Microsoft PL-300 MS Power BI Data Analyst.
* Experience in training in Power BI for IT and business.
* Experience in Python to read code.


 Consultant Requirements
   

  

* High competence in the current role.
* Serves as a role model for other consultants at a lower level.
* No requirement for team management.
* Ability to work independently.
* Normally achieved after 4-8 years of work in the current role.
* Proficient in spoken and written Swedish and English.


 Reference Assignments:
   

  

 The consultant must have completed at least two reference assignments related to Power BI development. The reference assignments must be no more than 3 years old. Upon request, at least two of the reference assignments must be confirmed with a named reference (name, email, and phone number).
   

  

 CV Requirements:
   

  

 We will verify that the consultant’s CV meets the specified requirements regarding experience and education. During an interview, additional questions may be asked to verify that the consultant possesses the required skills and experience. If the client determines that the consultant's CV and reference assignments do not meet the required criteria, the consultant will not be further considered.
   

  

 Basis for Awarding the Contract:
   

  

 The most economically advantageous bid will be evaluated based on the best price-quality ratio.
   

  

 Project Implementation, Timeline, and Scope:
   

  

* Start Date: 01 Dec 2024 or by agreement
* End Date: 15 Dec 2025
* Scope: 50% – varying workload per month (2-3 days per week), 1000 hours.
* Extension Possibility: Until 30 Jun 2026 (latest end date).
* Languages: Swedish
* Location: Stockholm


 Attachments:
   

  

* You need to be logged in to access attached files!
* Competence Matrix (should be completed and attached to your application).
* Reference Assignments (should be completed and attached to your application).


 Please apply directly via our system with the following:
   

  

* Your updated CV in Swedish (Word format), completed competence matrix, and reference assignments.
* Hourly rate (including overhead costs).
* Information about your availability to start the assignment.
* In the motivation section, explain why you are the best fit for this assignment.


 Please Note:
   

  

 We often evaluate applications on a rolling basis, which means we may remove the assignment from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in this opportunity, we recommend applying as soon as possible.
   

  

 Required Skills:
   

  

* Power BI
* Information Security
* Visualizations
* SQL


 Preferred Skills:
   

  

* Power BI Trainer
* Python
* Microsoft PL-300 MS Power BI Data Analyst Certification


 Languages:
   

  

* Swedish (Proficient)


**Benefits**
 PayExpress:
   

  

 We offer a fast and smooth payment solution, so you don’t have to wait through long payment periods. With us, you will receive your payment within 3-5 days after your timesheet has been approved. This benefit is included as standard in almost all our contracts with no extra work on your part.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**We are looking for a Cloud Platform Engineer to help us in scaling both our infrastructure and tooling to support more users and our growing product engineering organization.**
**What You'll Do**
 As a Cloud Platform Engineer at Mentimeter you will be a part of our Platform team, a team responsible for enabling product teams by providing a highly available, scalable and secure cloud infrastructure platform.
   

  

 You will work within an important function of the engineering organization, actively participating in technology choices and shaping our platform. Your team's work will empower our Product teams to run their code in a scalable and secure manner. This will involve close collaboration with other teams to ensure we set our engineering department up for success. Your team’s success will greatly impact Mentimeter, our engineers’ productivity, and developers’ experience.
   

  

 Daily tasks will involve addressing various scalability and reliability challenges in AWS and iterating on building a robust monitoring system for our production systems in collaboration with your team. You will work extensively with AWS, Terraform, DataDog, and infrastructure. Your responsibilities will include managing incidents, conducting thorough post-mortems to learn from them and prevent future occurrences, solving platform issues, and thinking ahead to build for the future in order to support the exponential growth of our company.This position offers the opportunity to grow your skills and expertise as a Platform Engineer by addressing challenging problems and learning from the outcomes.
   

  

 Technologies that you’ll be exposed includes AWS, Terraform, Ruby, Typescript, Cloudflare and Datadog, among others.
   

  

**Skills & Requirements**
**Who you are**
 You will have experience as a software developer and an interest in platform engineering. We believe you have in-depth experience with cloud architectures and specifically AWS. You should also be proficient in Terraform for infrastructure as code, both in terms of hands-on implementation but also promoting best practices and efficiency. An interest in reliability and observability is a plus.
   

  

 You have a keen interest in cloud technologies and improving engineering experience together with your team. You need to be interested in teamwork, problem solving, being a good communicator and evangelizing the solutions your team implements.
   

  

 Lastly you should be interested in the opportunity to work in an international environment with 50 different nationalities, where there’s lots of learning opportunities and room to grow.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Kubernetes Engineer
description:
Vi ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara "beside you", "behind you" och "before you". Vi kallar det för "The Iver way".
   

  

 Nu söker vi en
 
*Kubernetes Engineer* 
 som vill bli en del av Ivers avdelning Bank & Fintech och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

**Din roll på Iver?**
 Bank och Fintech är vårt affärsområde som arbetar med kunder inom bank, försäkring och fintech. Samtliga kunder inom affärsområdet har mycket höga krav på informationssäkerhet och ser automation som en naturlig del av leveransen.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i ett team om ca 35 personer med ansvar för plattformsutveckling och drift och gentemot en specifik kund. Kunden är ett teknikdrivet och branschledande fintechbolag med höga krav på informationssäkerhet.
   

  

 Du kommer få en viktig roll där du är drivande i arbetet med att ta fram nya lösningar och guida kunden framåt. Du arbetar i nära dialog med kunden och utvecklare för ständig förbättring och effektivisering av våra plattformar. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande och du kommer att hantera tekniska system i framkant och ansvara för dess utveckling och förbättring över tid.
   

  

 Teamet driver projekt där de utforskar nya tekniker och implementerar kontinuerligt nya lösningar i våran plattform. Teamet arbetar agilt och strukturerat i de olika projekten tillsammans med kund. I den här rollen har du goda möjligheter att utforma din roll efter vad du tycker är intressant.
   

  

 Vi arbetar bland annat med tekniker/metoder som Kubernetes / OpenShift, Linux, IaC, CI/CD, Bash, Python, GitOps, Grafana & Prometheus.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Iver - Where technology meets business. Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Iver är ett bolag med entreprenöriella rötter och en kultur som präglas av flexibilitet och samarbete. Vårt mål är att våra kunder – här i Norden och internationellt – ska se oss som en ledande partner för digital transformation.
   

  

 På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden.
   

  

 Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas. We’re not big blue. We’re yellow. Stora nog att skala och agila nog att innovera.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som är en lagspelare med ett stort tekniskt intresse och som har en vilja att förstå hur saker fungerar i grund och botten. Som person är du prestigelös, ansvarstagande och har en förmåga att förmedla lösningar på problem. Vi tror att Cybersäkerhet är ett område du finner intressant och du ser behovet av att förstå komplexa system, deras sårbarheter och att ständigt utveckla dessa.
   

  

 Du har god erfarenhet av att arbeta med Kubernetes och Linux. Vidare behärskar du ett eller flera script/programmeringsspråk samt har kunskap av Git och OpenSource projekt och metodiker.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes/OpenShift samt tillhörande IaC-verktyg
* Kubernetesrelaterade nätverksprodukter
* Kunskaper inom Git, ArgoCD, eller andra CI/CD-lösningar.
* God förståelse för hela IT-infrastrukturen.
* Goda kommunikationskunskaper med utvecklare, kunder & Operations team
* Förståelse för OpenSource / GitOps principer & arbetsmetodik
* God förståelse för utvecklingsprocesser och utmaningar för utvecklare


**Extra Meriterande Kunskaper**
* Erfarenhet av automatisering av applikationstester.
* Erfarenhet av Grafana, Karma, Zabbix eller andra monitoreringslösningar.
* God och pedagogisk förmåga att förklara komplexa problem.
* PKI
* AWS
* Programmeringskunskaper


**Övrig information:**
 Ivers affärsområde Bank & Fintech ansvarar för tjänsteleverans av cybersäkerhetstjänster och drift för kunder med särskilda säkerhetskrav. Av denna anledning kommer vi i rekryteringsprocessen genomföra bakgrundskontroller.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna tjänst är du placerad på Ivers kontor i Solna i nya lokaler, högt upp i Mall of Scandinavia.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Andreas Nilsson (andreas.nilsson@iver.se) eller Joacim Forsman (joacim.forsman@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Iver!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Alfa Laval Talent Program 2025 - IT
description:
Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.  

  

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.
Alfa Laval Talent Program is a ground-breaking program designed to attract top-tier talents and empower bright minds who possess the passion to make significant contributions in their fields of study and create an impact to the growth and success of Alfa Lava. Our primary goal is to establish a mutually beneficial relationship, where students can continuously learn and develop while we provide them the experience needed for their professional growth giving way for a promising and rewarding career journey with us.
Who you are
We are looking for students in Sweden who are currently in their 2nd or 3rd year of a 5-year degree, mainly Computer Engineering, Software Development, Computer Science, Engineering Physics and Mathematical Engineering.
To enjoy working at Alfa Laval you should have a solid drive and motivation to succeed, be able to work independently and enjoy working in teams. It is also essential that you have excellent networking capabilities. A good command of Swedish and English, both written and verbal is required as well as computer skills. Additionally, we value your participation in extracurricular activities and other interests.
What do we get* New ideas and inspiration from talented students.
* Have closer collaboration with students and universities.
* Attract potential employees.
* Establishing long term cooperation with hired talents.


What you will get* Practical Experience: Gain hands-on, field-specific experience building real-world skills from day one.
* Summer Job Placement: Secure meaningful summer roles each year, progressing from hands-on work within a production unit or office environment in the first summer to project-based experiences afterwards.
* Thesis Collaboration: Complete your thesis with Alfa Laval support, benefitting from industry expertise and resources.
* Mentorship: Receive dedicated coaching throughout the program, from start to thesis.
* Global Exposure & Networking: Connect with 21,000+ colleagues worldwide, building a strong international network.
* Career Pathways: Potential for employment with Alfa Laval post-graduation.


Assessment practicalities
We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this, we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.
For more information, please contact
Princess Jeremy Bondoc, Talent Acquisition Coordinator
princessjeremy.bondoc@alfalaval.com
Both Cover Letter and CV/Resume are required to be attached when applying for the program. This program will be based at our main headquarters in Lund, Sweden.
Please send your application no later than 16th of February 2025. We do not accept applications via email.
company_description: Alfa Laval is a leading global supplier of products and solutions for heat transfer, separation and fluid handling through our key products – heat exchangers, separators, pumps and valves.

title: IT-konsult inom servicedesk
description:
Älskar du att hjälpa till och har samtidigt en bred kompetens inom IT? I den här rollen som IT-konsult inom servicedesk kommer du få arbeta med användarsupport och lösning av IT-incidenter genom felsökning och diagnostisering.
 



  





 Uppdragslängd: start snarast – ca 6 månader med ev. möjlighet till förlängning.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Du kommer att arbeta med support för att hjälpa svenska användare och att lösa deras tekniska problem genom felsökning. Arbetet sker primärt via telefon och mailkontakt samt en viss del via på-platssupport. Du kommer även att hantera beställningar inom IT såsom datorer, skärmar m.m.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som trivs med att arbeta i en serviceroll, är kundfokuserad och serviceinriktad. Det är viktigt att du ser dig själv som en lagspelare som tillsammans med andra jobbar mot långsiktiga men även kortsiktiga mål. Du är van att jobba i ärendehanteringssystem, kunskapsdatabaser och remote-verktyg.
 



  





 Du pratar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat och din goda grund i engelska blir särskilt viktig då du kommer tillhöra ett virtuellt globalt IT-team med internationella kollegor och kunder.
 



 Som person är du nyfiken och engagerad och följer med i IT-utvecklingen. Andra viktiga egenskaper är att du vill utvecklas och har en lösningsorienterad inställning i allt du gör. Det här uppdraget passar dig med viljan att ge service och att utvecklas.
 



  





*Meriterande* 



* MS Office365
* Active Directory
* Applikationer t.ex. SAP och produktionsnära applikationer
* Kunskap inom telefoni och skrivare
* Språkkunskaper utöver svenska/engelska
* Förståelse för nätverk och kommunikation



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Utveckla din IT-karriär hos Centric!
description:
Vi söker engagerade supporttekniker till flera av våra kunder. Har du tidigare arbetat något år inom IT eller är du nyexaminerad från gymnasiet med erfarenhet av praktik inom IT och nu redo att komma ut i arbetslivet? Är du som person serviceinriktad, gillar att vara social i arbetet och har ett stort intresse för IT, datorer och nätverk? Då är du av stort intresse för oss!
 



  





 När du anställs hos oss ser vi en långsiktighet hos dig, vilket innebär att du kommer axla flera olika uppdrag hos oss. När du väl har arbetat hos oss på Centric i 2-3 år har du möjligheten att växa och ta ytterligare ett steg i din yrkeskarriär tillsammans med oss.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Du kommer att inta rollen som first line supporttekniker tillsammans med ett team. Som supporttekniker arbetar du med både mail och telefonkommunikation. I rollen ingår det även att registrera samt ta emot inkommande ärenden i ett ärendehanteringssystem. Du kommer bland annat att hantera användare i Active Directory och Microsoft 365 samt ge support via fjärrstyrning.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 Som person ser vi att du är social, lösningsorienterad och har ett genuint intresse för teknik. Du är självgående och tar egna initiativ samt vill ständigt utvecklas. Du motiveras av att ge bra service och har en god kommunikativ förmåga. Du talar och skriver svenska och engelska flytande.
 



  





*Krav* 



* Minst 6 månaders erfarenhet av praktisk IT-support
* Gått IT-gymnasium eller kurser inom IT
* God känsla för service
* God teknisk kunskap



  





*Meriterande* 



* Active Directory
* Office 365
* Microsoft 365
* Windows operativsystem



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Software Development Manager
description:
**Job Description**
 Join the Java Platform Group, and be part of the community which develops the Java SE platform, which is used across Enterprises, Governments, Education, and beyond.
   

  

 We are looking for a Java Sustaining Engineering Manager in Stockholm, Sweden, where you will lead work on the resolution of issues related to the Java Virtual Machine that impact the stability of Java in mission critical situations.
   

  

 For this position, the ideal candidate will have excellent leadership, problem solving skills, and communication skills combined with the ability to assess problems in Java application or the JDK itself, across the major releases of Java.
   

  

 As the ideal candidate for this role you will have already gained the experience of leading a team, and have the skills to mentor, and develop the careers of your employees. You will be able to show that you have experience developing, maintaining and supporting a software product.
   

  

**Core Experience And Qualifications**
* Coding experience in C/C++, Java
* Ideally experience with virtual machine technologies such as Just In Time (JIT) compilation, Garbage Collection techniques, or the Common Language Runtime (.NET), etc.


**Additional Qualifications**
* Demonstrate technical leadership skills
* Experience in Linux or Windows environments (macOS and Solaris are also desirable)
* Experience with Java application frameworks
* Strong organizational skills and written and oral communication in English, with other languages beneficial


**Responsibilities**
 In the role you will be working with a close-knit global team to ensure the regular release of Java updates and diagnose issues that come in against the Java platform. The JVM Sustaining manager will work effectively with multiple internal groups such as Product Development teams, Product Management, Support, and Customer Management.
   

  

 While the position will be based out of Stockholm, Sweden, you will be part of a global team with the need to attend meetings that overlap with California, and some limited travel may be necessary. You should be able to work out of our Stockholm offices overlooking the Riddarfjärden for a minimum of three days a week and there will be occasional on-call requirements during the evening, weekend, and holiday hours - outside of this there is flexibility in the hours worked.
   

  

 We will be looking for someone who enjoys problem solving, picking up details quickly and juggling multiple issues. Being part of a global team you should have the energy and drive to be a presence in and out of any meetings always looking for opportunities for improvement and innovation.
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: We want more people in the kitchen at Pinchos Sundbyberg/ Souschef
description:
**We are looking for new coworkers to the kitchen!**
*At Pinchos our values and our commitment to each employee live and develop. That's why it's important to find nice people who fit right into our culture and our restaurant environment, because when everyone is comfortable and well, the job also works better!*
 We welcome a high volume of guests in our kitchen every day and strive to exceed their expectations. With the fast pace that comes with this, it's important to stay calm, focused, and enjoy interacting with our guests while working in an open kitchen environment.
   

  

 We value a mix of skills and experience in our kitchens, meaning that if you have cooking experience, we can offer you a workplace where you can grow and develop. At the same time, we are excited to welcome those who are new to the industry. While formal training or years of experience as a chef aren't required, a passion for learning and a drive to improve can more than make up for any lack of knowledge!
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Pinchos we believe in delivering a WOW experience both to our guests and also to our employees. We encourage all employees to be themselves, and that your unique personality along with everyone else's is what makes up Pinchos personality!
   

  

 Pinchos is a restaurant concept based on an original Swedish idea from Gothenburg in 2012. The head office is also established in Gothenburg. In addition to offering a wide, varied selection of small dishes in premises with extravagant decor, Pinchos also distinguishes itself by being the world's first app restaurant. Since the start, our guests have taken both us, our app and our food to their hearts. In 2014, the concept was opened up to franchisees and in 2017 an international establishment was started. The chain currently has over 70 restaurants and is expanding steadily.
   

  

 What we can offer you
   

  

* a fun workplace
* big opportunities to develop throughout the chain
* an innovative concept
* amazing coworkers!


 In order to fit in with us, we believe that you
   

  

* have previous experience from working in a kitchen
* are flexible and innovative
* thrive at a fast pace
* appreciate the guest contact that our open kitchens offer
* spread positive energy around you
* are good at ensuring quality
* appreciate that our food is prepared according to recipes
* are fast, accurate and efficient
* are open and want to give of yourself


 Does this sound like something for you? Make sure to apply for the position now!

title: Senior Security GRC Manager - SOC 2 Compliance
description:
Spotify is seeking a Senior Security Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) Manager to join the Security Studio who will work closely with our engineering teams and audit functions. You’ll be focused on handling the execution of tasks for the Security GRC Program within Spotify, primarily in relation to driving SOC 2 compliance, but also to other compliance and information security frameworks. You will work on ensuring tasks deliver high-quality value and are completed in a timely fashion. Additionally, you will play an integral part in recommending process improvements and in helping to implement these updates. This role will require a deep understanding of SOC 2 compliance, information security practices, as well as experience in working with technology teams.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Lead the SOC 2 compliance program and large-scale SOC 2 projects, identify dependencies, define success metrics and achievements, and ensure timely delivery
* Design, implement, monitor and maintain SOC 2 controls, while collaborating and building relationships with internal and external business partners
* Lead and handle all stages of SOC 2 audits, ensuring successful completion.
* Resolve appropriate scope of SOC 2 audits, encompassing new and existing service offerings, their supporting infrastructure, and associated processes.
* Lead and respond to customer security questionnaires while collaborating with internal teams, and drive questionnaire response automation
* Identify, assess, and advise on information security risks, processes and controls to a variety of business partners


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience with SOC 2 compliance, including leading a SOC 2 compliance program, controls design, and implementation. Experience in the technology industry is preferred.
* You have 5+ years of experience with security frameworks, e.g. SOC 2, ISO27001, NIST CSF, PCI-DSS, etc., security controls design and implementation, and security best practices
* Prior IT Audit experience in areas of SOC 2, ITGC, SOX are preferred
* CISA, CISM, CISSP or other related certifications are preferred but not required.
* You have experience with privacy frameworks, such as GDPR or CCPA
* You are a strong collaborator, with experience working on teams composed of both technical and non-technical members
* You have a demonstrated ability to lead large projects, problem-solve, multitask, and have excellent organizational skills
* You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, with experience presenting to key stakeholders and partnering with internal collaborators and external auditors
* You thrive in a data-driven, fast-paced and innovative environment


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* For this role you will be in Stockholm.


 #JobSite-Featured
   

  

 #JobSite-Sub-Security
   

  

 #JobSite-Main-Product
   

  

 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Business Analyst till vårt Intelligent Automation team!
Sales Analyst
description:
**About CDON** 




 Join us at CDON Group, a Swedish listed company with a long history and extensive experience in the e-commerce market. Our mission is to unleash the power of the marketplace to give the best shopping experience in the Nordics.
 



  





 We are dedicated to providing great online shopping experiences and are on the lookout for a Sales Analyst to join us on this journey for our two Nordic marketplaces: CDON and Fyndiq.
 



  





**About the role** 




 CDON Group isn't just another e-commerce company; we have two different marketplaces that handle nearly 4 million visitors each month. Our platform is a bustling hub of millions of products, connecting buyers and sellers across four dynamic markets. And behind the scenes, it's your data-driven insights that will fuel our growth and shape our success.
 



  





 As our Sales Analyst, you'll be the 'control room' for our sales performance. You'll have your finger on the pulse of our business, monitoring trends, spotting anomalies, and translating complex data into actions. Think of it as a blend of detective work, strategic problem-solving, and storytelling - all with the goal of driving sales and optimising the customer experience.
 



  





**Responsibilities includes:** 




  





**Sales Analysis** 



* Analyse large datasets to provide insights on marketplace performance, customer behaviour, and business trends.
* Perform deep-dive analyses as needed to answer specific sales questions and support data-driven decision-making
* Create and maintain reports and dashboards in our BI tool to track key performance indicators (KPIs) across traffic, sales, and customer engagement.



  





**Behaviour Analysis** 



* Proactively conduct behavioural analyses and deliver recommendations based on website usage to improve conversion and customer experience
* Own and manage GA4 and Google Tag Manager
* General analytical support in the organisation including traffic, site, conversion, sales and much more



  





**Cross-Departmental Collaboration** 




 To be successful in this role, you will need to have a good cooperation with other parts in the organisation such as:
 


* Product: To incorporate user insights into web design and functionality
* Brand & CX: To enhance customer insights with channel and website data
* Data: To align resources, needs and projects within business analysis



  





**Qualifications and requirements** 



* Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset, with the ability to interpret complex market data and generate insights, and provide actionable recommendations.
* A customer-focused approach, with a commitment to continuous improvement and innovation
* Visual storytelling: Strong ability to craft visually compelling and clear reports that not only convey complex data insights effectively but also engage the audience.
* Communication skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, Fluent in English and Swedish, both spoken and written
* Detail-oriented: High attention to detail and accuracy in your work, ensuring data quality and consistency
* Ability to analyse behavioural data and draw strategic conclusions for website improvements
* A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Marketing, Statistics, Business, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field



  





**What we offer** 




 An opportunity to be part of a unique growth journey, actively contributing to the success of the leading e-commerce marketplaces in the Nordics. A collaborative and dynamic work environment, with passionate colleagues who believe in CDON Group’s mission. Competitive compensation package, including benefits such as pension and insurance through Max Matthiessen and MyBenefit portal. Career growth opportunities within a rapidly evolving company.
 



  





**Application Process:** 




 Please attach your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your interest and suitability for the job. We will be conducting interviews with candidates on an ongoing basis.
 



  





 To ensure a professional and unbiased assessment, we will ask candidates to perform a combination of logical reasoning and personality tests as part of the process.

title: Customs Manager to Mycronic!
description:
Think of the most high-tech electronics products you can imagine. Then think one step further. What technology creates the most advanced high-tech of today? Mycronic´s do. With unique and world-leading production solutions, they spearhead the electronics industry. Right now, Mycronic are on a journey of growth, where they continue to explore new markets and expand worldwide. Do you have several years of work experience within the customs- and import area and are looking for a role
where you will have the chance to truly contribute with your expertise? Read on!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Mycronic AB (publ)
 



  

**City :**
 Täby
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Mycronic is a Swedish high-tech company and have been a trusted partner to electronics and display manufacturers worldwide for more than 50 years. They are headquartered in Stockholm, Täby and with subsidiaries, agents and distributors in more than 50 countries. Currently, there is no other company in the entire world that can compete with Mycronic's technology. All high-resolution screens you see, whether it's a TV, phone, tablet, Apple Watch, etc., are made using Mycronic´s machines. Mycronic continues to grow in a wide range of industries and the Pattern Generator (PG) division you will belong to has a unique market position as the world's leading supplier of mask writers for the manufacture of advanced photomasks. As Customs Manager, you have an important role in driving the operational work within the customs- and import area for the entire PG division and you are a key player in bringing out the importance of this area within the organization. You will belong to the Production Support & Outbound department currently consisting of 15 people and your closest team of 2 persons which you will work closely with. Due to an upcoming retirement, we are now looking for a replacement who will work with developing this area further. Mycronic's current Customs Manager will remain during your initial period to ensure a smooth transition and help you integrate into your role effectively.
 



  

**Work tasks**




 You will work in a very central role with great opportunities to influence working methods, logistics flows, costs and how the area develops, both in the short and long term. You collaborate closely with both internal stakeholders such as R&D, purchasing, the legal department and subsidiaries in Eastern Asia and the US, as well as external stakeholders and you will both participate in and run meetings with them.
 



 Furthermore, you will…
 


* Follow up on deviations, collect data and ensure correct declaration of products
* Support the global trade and logistics team on customs and classification matters
* Be responsible for the contact with external customs specialists and escalate if agreements are not followed
* Develop and maintain the customs process in Mycronic's management systems
* Stay up to date with news within the import- and customs area
  


**We are looking for**

 In this recruitment, we will place great emphasis on your personal competencies and your interest in the position and Mycronic as a company. We see that you both understand and are driven to develop how Mycronic works with deviations, are good at delegating and pushing for change. You have an organized way of working, do not hesitate to navigate between different stakeholders and are pedagogical in your communication.
 



 Furthermore, you have…
 


* A post-secondary education in, for example, logistics, finance, purchasing or similar
* Several years of work experience with deviation and classification of articles
* Experience of working with authorities
* Very good knowledge in both Swedish and English since both languages ​are used in your daily work


 W
 
  

**e see it as a merit if you have…**



* D
 
 eep knowledge especially in section XVI (Chapter 84-85) and section XVIII (Chapter 90)
* E
 
 xperience with special cases within the tariff and classification area (e.g. dealing with misclassifications)
* E
 
 xperience with the application process for classification for binding tariff information (BTI) and validate BTI
* E
 
 xperience of working with free trade agreements/origin calculation


 I
 
  

**nformation about the recruitment process**



* P
 
 hone interview with Academic Work
* P
 
 ersonality- and problem-solving test
* I
 
 n depth interview with Academic Work
* I
 
 nterviews with Mycronic
* R
 
 eference checking and decision


 O
 
  

**ther information**



* L
 
 ocation: Headquarters in Täby, Stockholm
* E
 
 xtent: Fulltime, permanent employment
* C
 
 ontact information: Senior Recruitment Consultant Johanna Sörell, Johanna.sorell@academicwork.se


 M
   

  

  

  

**ycronic AB (publ)R**

 ead more about Mycronic on their website: https://www.mycronic.com/G

 hen you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.D

title: Business Development - Stockholm
description:
THE ROLE
   

  

 Are you someone who thrives on building something new and lasting? As our first dedicated Business Development Representative, you’ll be laying the groundwork for Fixate’s future by driving lead generation, creating new business relationships, and transforming leads into long-term partnerships. You won’t just be filling a role; you’ll be building Fixate’s business development framework from the ground up, helping us shape the company as we grow.
   

  

**What Success Looks Like**
**Targets** 
 : Your core metrics include at least 16 qualified meetings monthly, with a primary focus on signing one new client per month. Achieving these milestones will directly drive our growth.
   

  

**Growth Path** 
 : You’ll begin with cold outreach, expand into inbound lead generation, and ultimately take on managing business development suppliers. As Fixate grows, so will your influence, with the potential to lead the entire business development operation.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute both inbound and outbound lead strategies that make a real impact.
* Create and publish engaging content to boost brand awareness and generate inbound leads.
* Actively seek out and pursue new business opportunities across Denmark, Sweden, the UK, and The Netherlands.
* Qualify prospects and set up high-value meetings to build potential partnerships.
* Continuously refine our outreach strategy - always looking for ways to improve.
* Train and manage external partners to amplify our outreach efforts.


**Skills & Experience**
* CRM Expertise: Experience in setting up and using CRM systems and processes will be a strong asset, ensuring we can scale outreach smoothly.
* Natural Communicator: You’re a standout in both spoken and written communication, and your outreach messages make an impact.
* Self-Motivated and Organised: You take ownership, prioritising and driving your activities independently.
* Industry Background: Proven business development experience in a service industry would be a great fit.
* Languages: Fluent in English and Swedish is essential. If you also speak Danish, or Dutch, even better.


 IMPORTANT CHARACTERISTICS
   

  

* Client-Centric Focus: Your understanding of market dynamics and customer needs will shape our outreach approach and ensure it resonates with prospects.
* Adaptability and Resilience: You’ll experiment, pivot, and learn in real-time, adapting as needed to meet Fixate’s evolving goals.
* Problem-Solver: You see solutions where others see challenges and thrive when things don’t come with a step-by-step guide.
* Entrepreneurial Mindset: Autonomy isn’t just a perk here - it’s a requirement. You’ll be making decisions, driving initiatives, and setting strategies from day one.


**What We Offer**
* Impact and Ownership: With full ownership of Fixate’s lead generation, you’ll see the direct results of your work and play a vital role in Fixate’s growth.
* Career Progression: As Fixate scales, so will your role - progressing from outreach to leading the full business development operation.
* Client-Centric KPIs: We measure success based on client satisfaction, quality of relationships, and value delivered - our approach goes beyond just numbers.
* Flexible, Dynamic Environment: You’ll have the freedom to shape Fixate’s future and pursue strategies that make a real difference.
* Rewards for Impact: Our compensation structure reflects your contributions, with a base salary, performance-based bonuses, and potential equity as Fixate grows.


**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
 karl@fixate.nu or phone number +46706011614

title: Regional Partnerships Manager
description:
We're at an exciting and key moment of growth here at EasyPark, leading the way in digital parking solutions. With offices in the heart of
 **Stockholm** 
 and central
 **Oslo** 
 , we're expanding our B2B team and looking for a driven
 **Regional Partnerships Manager** 
 to spearhead our growth in the Nordic & Netherlands regions. At EasyPark, we value innovation, collaboration, and the drive to make a real impact.
   

  

**The Role**
 As our Regional Partnerships Manager, you'll play a crucial role in enhancing our partnership landscape. Your work will directly contribute to our strategic goals, facilitating growth and enhancing customer value through relevant B2B Partnerships.
   

  

 You'll be leading the business to drive new innovative ways to manage and grow our existing partnerships, negotiate new ones in close collaboration with our product team, and coordinate go-to-market strategies across the Nordics region and Netherlands with internal and external commercial organizations. .
   

  

 This role is a unique blend of strategy, negotiation, and cross-functional collaboration, offering the chance to work closely with our product, legal, finance, sales, and marketing teams.
   

  

 You'll be instrumental in driving and implementing our Regional Partnerships Strategy which will act as a Blue Print to scale within the business!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Own the negotiation and relationship management for fleet management and connected services partnerships.
* Serve as the regional commercial go-to-market lead, driving strategy and execution for B2B partnerships.
* Coordinate cross-functional teams in rolling out partnership initiatives, ensuring alignment with our commercial objectives.
* Act as the commercial point of contact, both internally and externally, fostering strong, productive relationships.
* Utilize market insights and customer feedback to inform and refine our partnership strategies.


**What You'll Bring**
* Proven experience in partnerships and go-to-market strategies, ideally within the Nordics.
* Strong negotiation skills, with a track record of successful contract negotiations.
* A passion for technology and innovation, coupled with strong project management and stakeholder management skills.
* An entrepreneurial mindset, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Fluency in English is a must, with proficiency in Norwegian or Swedish highly advantageous.


**What's In It For You**
* Be at the forefront of digital innovation in a company that's leading the charge in smart parking solutions.
* The opportunity to see the immediate impact of your work on our company's growth and success.
* A collaborative and supportive work environment that fosters development and growth.


 If you're driven by innovation, thrive in collaborative environments, and are looking to make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you. Apply today to join us in shaping the future of digital parking solutions!

title: VP Revenue Operations
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for a commercially focused
 **VP of Revenue Operations** 
 to operationalize revenue strategies across our customer journey. This role is new at Mentimeter and will be crucial in further enhancing our revenue generating capabilities and ensuring a cohesive approach to driving revenue across the customer journey. We have a product-led growth go-to-market and our revenue comes from both self-service customers & enterprise customers. You will work with areas such as refining & streamlining operational workflows, identifying gaps in our understanding of operational performance & defining analysis to-be-done as well as ensuring alignment across commercial departments.
   

  

 You will report to the COO in a central department but working closely with catalysing revenue leaders in our commercial departments (sales, marketing & product). You will be responsible for leading & supporting a team consisting of our Sales Operations Director, Martech & Operations Director & Product Growth Lead which all work embedded in our commercial departments. The total extended teams working with the Revenue Operations area is roughly 10-15 people.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Strategic direction of Revenue Operations: Together with our CSO, CPO and CMO set the 3 year strategic agenda for how the Revenue Operations area will contribute to Mentimeter’s success
* Operationalization of revenue strategies: Responsible for the overview and refinement of end-to-end revenue processes, identifying gaps in our workflows across the customer journey as well as identifying new revenue operations enabled commercial opportunities
* Strategic Alignment: Align initiatives, approaches and definitions across departments to ensure a cohesive approach to driving revenue across the customer journey
* Facilitate data enabled commercial teams: Collaborate with our VP of Data & Analytics to leverage data to empower our commercial teams. Be the commercial counterpart for e.g. data activation & data collection. Support operational analysis & forecasting, identify gaps in our understanding of operational performance as well as defining analysis to-be-done and predictive data models needed.
* Support alignment of priorities: Facilitate joint goal setting & alignment of priorities across departments. Own and develop our central planning process to ensure cross-functional resource allocation for efficient execution
* Technology and tooling: Own the vision for the tech & tooling needed to manage and optimise the end-to-end revenue process - including adoption of new technology such as generative AI. Accountable for selection, implementation and management of tools that support the revenue-generating functions e.g. CRM systems, automation tools, and other tools that facilitate effective commercial operations.
* People engagement, performance & retention for the RevOps teams: Responsible for the employee engagement, performance & retention in the Revenue Operations teams


**We Believe You Have**
* 10+ years relevant experience, whereof at least 6 years leadership experience
* Proven experience of being responsible for Revenue Operations in a fast-paced SaaS environment
* A proven track record of revenue growth attributed to your work
* A solid understanding of all parts of Revenue Operations (from strategy to tooling to organisational alignment)
* Strong execution skills with a love for getting things done - you know how to transform a strategic directions to successful Revenue Operations
* Strong leadership skills and a track record of successfully coaching other leaders
* Strong collaboration and stakeholder management skills (you will be collaborating with many different functions and people)
* Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to define analysis to-be-done
* Deep knowledge in Salesforce CRM and preferably also experience from marketing automation platforms, eg. Braze or similar


**It’s a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience from working with Revenue Operations in a product lead growth & sales motion
* Have worked in a scale up environment at a company of a similar size
* Have earlier experience of reporting directly to someone in the management team


 Please note that this role will have its base in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 and is primarily an onsite role with the opportunity to work from home twice per week.
   

  

 Click here to learn more about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Introduction interview - Meet TA rep and/or hiring manager for introduction interviews
* Business Case - Conduct a business case showcasing your operational & strategic skills, knowledge and core competencies
* Competence interview - Meet the team for an onsite deep dive interview
* Alva Labs tests - conduct a personality and logical ability test as part of the screening process
* Culture & Leadership interview - Reflect more about our 5 core values and why you would be a great fit at Mentimeter


**Apply today and join the team at Mentimeter!**
 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.
